intro: Cynoglossum lancifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, known for its hairy stems and showy flowers. Cynoglossum lancifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
